com.firebase.authwrapper.providers.common.base

Class ProviderBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.firebase.authwrapper.providers.common.base.ProviderBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FacebookProvider, GoogleProvider, MailProvider, NullProvider

    public abstract class ProviderBase
extends java.lang.Object

    This Class is the providers base class. Contains all mutual methods (behaviors) for all concrete providers, including a base ctor. Apart of implementing concrete methods, the ProviderBase declares several abstract behaviors which needed implementation in derived providers.

    As an abstract class (not pure interface), this class implements some of the functionality exposed to the provider delegate. This provider delegate, invoked by the singleton ProviderManager which exposed to the user.

    Since:
    10-5-2018
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    ron barnoy
    See Also:
    Provider

    • Method Detail

      • Register

        public void Register(AuthenticationListener authenticationListener)
        Register a listener to the provider class. The listener holds several callbacks which will be reflected on the sender class.
        Parameters:
        authenticationListener - listener for communicating the sender to the providers flow
        See Also:
        AuthenticationListener

      • UnRegister

        public void UnRegister(AuthenticationListener authenticationListener)
        UnRegister listener from the provider. The listener holds several callbacks which will be reflected on the sender class.
        Parameters:
        authenticationListener - listener for communicating the sender to the providers flow.
        See Also:
        AuthenticationListener

      • SignOut

        public void SignOut()
        This method signout the target provider from Firebase authentication server.

      • SignIn

        public void SignIn(java.lang.String email,
                   java.lang.String Password,
                   AuthenticationListener.Email callback)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        SignIn method using mail and password. Implemented only in MailProvider. The other concrete providers (except NullProvider throw this exception.

        The reason that this method is found in ProviderBase (and not exclusively found in MailProvider) is that this method must be exposed to the end user. This can only be done if it will be exposed to Provider delegate object.

        Parameters:
        email - an email address string
        Password - an email password string
        callback - Email callback implemented by the user application
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - this exception is triggered only if other concrete provider (either of MailProvider called this method.
        See Also:
        MailProvider

      • SendEmailVerification

        public void SendEmailVerification(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        This method is used for sending verification mail to the current user, after this user was successfully registered by using MailProvider

        The reason that this method is found in ProviderBase (and not exclusively found in MailProvider) is that this method must be exposed to the end user. This can only be done if it will be exposed to Provider delegate object.

        Parameters:
        user - the target user which will receive this verfication mail
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - this exception is triggered only if other concrete provider (either of MailProvider called this method.
        See Also:
        MailProvider
